question: I'd never given much thought to how I would die.. ... So I can't bring myself to regret the decision that brought me here to die... ... The decision to leave home. Have a good.. ... life.
answer: It won't work again, baby.

question: You put it on hold.
answer: I did?

question: Look. You also called Mexico.
answer: I'll figure it out. You gotta be able to reach me and Phil on the road -

question: Very romantic.
answer: Now, you know if you change your mind, I'll race back here from wherever the game is.

question: I won't change my mind, mom.
answer: You might. You've always hated Forks.

question: It's not about Forks, it's about Dad. I mean, two weeks a year, we barely know each other.
answer: Your hair's longer.

question: I cut it since last time I saw you.
answer: Guess it grew out again. How's your mom?

question: Good. That's right. One bathroom.
answer: I'll just put these up in your room

question: I can do it
answer: Bella, you remember Billy Black.

question: I rebuilt the engine and -
answer: It's perfect!

question: Okay, so you gotta double pump the clutch when you shift, but -
answer: Maybe I can give you a ride to school.

question: I go to school on the reservation.
answer: Too bad. Would've been nice to know at least one person.

question: Too bad. Would've been nice to know at least one person.
answer: You're Isabella Swan, the new girl. Hi. I'm Eric. The eyes and ears of this place. Anything you need. Tour guide, lunch date, shoulder to cry on.

question: I'm kind of the suffer in silence type.
answer: Good headline for your feature

question: I -- no, I'm not news -- I'm, seriously, not at all
answer: Whoa, chillax. No feature. You've missed a lot of the semester, but I can hook you up - tutor, cliff notes, medical excuse..

question: Ow!
answer: (hurries to him,

question: It's only a flesh wound. You're Isabella, right?
answer: Just Bella.

question: The Cullens.
answer: Doctor and Mrs. Cullen's foster kids. They all moved down here from Alaska two years ago.

question: They kinda keep to themselves.
answer: Because they're all together. Like, together together. The blonde girl, Rosalie, and the big dark-haired guy, Emmett.. ... they're a thing. I'm not even sure that's legal.

question: Jess, they're not actually related.
answer: But they live together. And the little dark haired girl, Alice, she's really weird.. ... she's with Jasper, the blonde who looks like he's in pain.

question: That'd be great, thank you. So... you eat here every night?
answer: Easier than washing dishes.

question: I can cook. I do the cooking at home - in Phoenix. Mom's not great in the kitchen.
answer: I remember.. How was school? Meet anyone?

question: A few people... Do you know the Cullen family?
answer: Are people talking about them again?

question: No... well, a little.
answer: Just cause they're newcomers. We're lucky to have a surgeon like Dr. Cullen at our podunk hospital. Lucky his wife wanted to live in a small town. Lucky his kids aren't like a lot of the hell-raisers around here.

question: ... Okay.
answer: I just don't like narrow mindedness.

question: Dad, I'm heading out. 33 EXT. CHARLIE'S HOUSE - MORNING 33 ON BELLA'S FACE as she opens the door and stops, dismay filling her. It's pouring down rain --the yard is full of puddles, some frozen. Bella shivers, wraps her coat tight. Great. WHIP PAN to the driveway as Charlie pulls in -driving her truck. Dad, I can drive myself to school.
answer: You okay, Bells?

question: Ice doesn't help the uncoordinated.
answer: That's why I got you new tires. She looks over at the truck -- yep, four new tires.

question: You got me new tires. No one's ever done that before. I mean... nothing.
answer: I'll be late for dinner. I'm heading down to Mason County. A security guard at the Grisham Mill got killed by some kind of animal..

question: An animal?
answer: You're not in Phoenix any more, honey. They've been hunting it for a week with no luck. Thought I'd lend a hand.

question: Be careful.
answer: Always am.

question: Ladies first.
answer: You've been gone.

question: Out of town. For personal reasons.
answer: Prophase.

question: May I look? Prophase.
answer: Like I said.

question: Enjoying the rain?
answer: Seriously? You're asking me about the weather?

question: It appears.
answer: No. I don't like the cold. Or the wet. Or the gray. Or parkas. Or turtle necks. May I?

question: Like I said.
answer: It's complicated.

question: I think I can keep up.
answer: My mother remarried.

question: Very complex. So you don't like him.
answer: Phil is fine. Young for her, but nice enough.

question: But now you're unhappy.
answer: No... I -- I just.. Did you get contacts?

question: Bells. Are you alright?
answer: I'm fine, dad. Calm down. It's okay, Tyler.

question: It sure as hell is not okay.
answer: Dad, it's not his fault-

question: We nearly lost you.
answer: But you didn't.

question: Can I talk to you for a moment? How did you get over to me so quickly?
answer: I was standing right next to you.

question: You were next to your car, across the lot. Yes. You were.
answer: You're confused. You hit your head.

question: I know what I saw.
answer: And what, exactly, was that?

question: You stopped that van. You pushed it away.
answer: No one will believe that.

question: I wasn't planning to tell anyone. I just want to know the truth.
answer: Can't you just thank me and get over it? You're not going to let it go, are you?

question: No.
answer: Then I hope you enjoy disappointment.

question: Why did you even bother?
answer: ... I don't know.

question: Look! You're moving. You're ALIVE!
answer: ... Yeah, false alarm..

question: Actually, I'm glad you're not dead cause - well, that would suck, plus So what do you think? You want to go? To prom. With me.
answer: Prom. As in dance. I, uh - have to go

question: You can't go another weekend?
answer: Non-refundable ticket. Maybe you should ask Jessica.

question: Hello, Edward. Really?
answer: What's in Jacksonville?

question: How did you know about that?
answer: You didn't answer my question.

question: You haven't answered any of mine. You won't even say hello.
answer: Hello.

question: And how did you stop that van?
answer: Adrenaline rush. Very common. Google it. It helps if you actually watch where you put your feet. I know I've been rude, but it's for the best.

question: I'll go if you stop saying that.
answer: Edible art..

question: Thanks... but your mood swings are giving me whiplash.
answer: I said it would be better if we weren't friends, not that I didn't want to be.

question: What does that even mean?
answer: It means if you were smart, you'd avoid me.

question: So let's say, for argument's sake, that I'm not smart. Would you talk to me? Tell me the truth?
answer: Probably not. I'd rather hear your theories.

question: Okay... how bout radioactive spiders? Kryptonite?
answer: (levels his gaze,

question: No. I don't believe that. You're not bad. You can be a jerk, but it's like this... mask. To keep people away. Look, why don't we just - hang out. Like... come to the beach with us. It'll be fun - sand fleas, wind burn, salt water stinging your eyes..
answer: Which beach?

question: La Push. Is something wrong with that beach?
answer: It's just a little crowded.

question: You know them? You want to go look at tide pools? So, what did your friend mean about the Cullens not coming here?
answer: Oops. Caught that, huh? I'm not supposed to say anything.

question: I can keep a secret.. Like fur, fangs ... doggy breath? So the legend about the Cullens is..
answer: Well, they're supposedly descended from this, like..

question: Didn't they just move here?
answer: Or just moved back.

question: Riiiight. So what was this treaty? Wait... what were they really?
answer: It's just a story, Bella.

question: Look, just take my bag.
answer: Get in.

question: What -- no, how did you find -- ?
answer: I should go back and rip their heads off.

question: No. Bad idea.
answer: You don't know the vile, repulsive things they were thinking.

question: And you do?
answer: Not hard to guess.

question: I could eat. You're not eating?
answer: I'm on a special diet.

question: Like South Beach?
answer: Not exactly.

question: So how bout some answers?
answer: Yes, no. To get to the other side, and 1 point 772453851.

question: I didn't ask for the square root of pi.
answer: You knew that?

question: How did you know where I was?
answer: I didn't. Don't go.

question: Were you following me?
answer: I feel very protective of you.

question: So that's a yes?
answer: Yes, I followed you. I tried to keep my distance...until you needed help.

question: You said before... That you heard what those guys were thinking..
answer: I have no idea. I can read every mind in there, except yours.

question: Why, what's wrong with me?
answer: I tell you I read minds and you think there's something wrong with you?

question: What is it?
answer: I... don't have the strength to stay away from you anymore.

question: Edward, you don't have to.
answer: This is wrong.

question: Edward
answer: You're cold. We should go.

question: I think I'm warm enough now. Your hand, it's still freezing cold.
answer: That's my father's car. What's he -- ? Carlisle. What happened?

question: Waylon Forge was found in the woods out near his place. I just examined the body.
answer: He died? How?

question: Animal attack.
answer: The same kind that killed the security guard down in Mason?

question: Most likely.
answer: So it's getting closer to town.

question: Dad, I'm sorry about Waylon.
answer: Known him going on thirty years. We'll get to the bottom of this, Bella. But in the meantime.. ... I want you to have this.

question: That's probably not a good
answer: It'll give me some peace of mind.

question: You're impossibly fast. And strong. Your skin is pale-white, ice-cold. Your eyes change color. And sometimes you speak like... you're from a different time. How old are you?
answer: Seventeen.

question: How long have you been seventeen?
answer: ... A while.

question: I know what the Cold Ones are. What you are.
answer: Say it. Out loud. Say it.

question: ... Vampire
answer: Are you afraid?

question: No. You won't hurt me. You're different.
answer: You think you know me?

question: Where are we going?
answer: Up the mountain. Out of the cloud bank. You need to see what

question: No! The sunlight will kill you.
answer: Myth. You need to see the truth.

question: Slow down.
answer: Are you afraid?

question: No.
answer: Then come with me. Someplace where no one can protect you. Where

question: I'm not afraid.
answer: Hold on. Are you afraid! ?

question: No! Edward? Where are you?
answer: This is what I am.

question: You're... beautiful.. I don't believe that.
answer: Because you believe the lie. The camouflage. I'm the world's most dangerous predator. Everything about me invites you in - my voice, my face, even my smell. As if As if you could outrun me. As if you could fight me off. I'm designed to kill.

question: I don't care.
answer: I've killed people.

question: It doesn't matter.
answer: I wanted to kill you. I've never wanted a human's blood so much in my life. I'm dangerous to you.

question: I trust you.
answer: Don't.

question: I trust you, Edward. I'm here. Edward?
answer: You... took me by surprise. I don't know how to... do this. Me, and my family, we're different from others of our kind. We're not nomadic, we have a permanent home. We only hunt animals. We've learned to control our thirst..

question: Oh... I thought you hated me when we met.
answer: I did. For making me want you so badly. I'm still not sure I can control myself.

question: I know you can.
answer: I wish I could understand this thing you see in me. You look at me with those eyes..

question: I'm afraid.
answer: Good.

question: Not of that. I'm afraid... you'll disappear. That I'll lose you.
answer: Be very still. And so the lion fell for the lamb.

question: Stupid lamb.
answer: Sick masochistic lion.

question: How long have you been like this?
answer: Since nineteen-eighteen. That's when Carlisle found me.

question: Where'd he find you?
answer: In a hospital, dying of Spanish influenza. My parents had already died. Not just. Our bite contains venom. And once we taste blood, a sort of.. First with me, then with his wife, Esme. He found her in a hospital, as well. The others followed.

question: Does someone have to be dying to become like you?..
answer: ... No, that's just Carlisle. He would never do... this, to someone who had another choice.

question: So Carlisle's the reason why you hunt animals, instead of people.
answer: Not the only reason. I don't want to be a monster. We call ourselves vegetarians, by the way... For our kind, hunting animals is like living on tofu. It keeps you strong but isn't very satisfying.

question: Show off.
answer: It's not that impressive, really. Anyone in my family can do this.

question: Can they all read minds, too?
answer: No, that's unique to me. But Alice can see the future. Her visions are very subjective. The future can change. Come to my house tomorrow.

question: Your house? With your family? But... what if they don't like me? I'm glad I amuse you. What is it?
answer: A complication. I'll pick you up tomorrow.

question: It's... wonderful.
answer: You expected turrets, dungeons and moats?

question: No... not moats. He takes her hand. She girds herself. They head inside. It's so light and open.
answer: Thanks to tinted windows... It's the one place we never have to hide. I told them not to do this.

question: Graduation caps?
answer: A private joke. We matriculate a lot.

question: What a nightmare, repeating high school.
answer: True, but the younger we start out in a new place, the longer we can stay there. ... and this is my room.

question: So you're obsessed with music. But..
answer: No sleep.

question: Ever?
answer: No nightmares, no drool, no snoring. Do you have any favorites?

question: Depends. Alternative? Jazz? Sixties, seventies..
answer: Ooh, she knows her music. Alright, nineties. Eighteen-nineties. Classical.

question: I'd have to say... Debussy.
answer: My favorite, too.

question: No dancing.
answer: Ever?

question: No tripping, no falling, no derision.
answer: I can always make you.

question: You don't scare me.
answer: You really shouldn't have said that.

question: Your friends are flagging you. It's okay you wanna join them. I'm just gonna turn in early anyway.
answer: Yeah, me, too.

question: It's a Friday night. Go out. The Newton boy's got a big smile for you. Nice family, the Newtons.
answer: He's just a friend.

question: None of the boys in town interest you?
answer: We're not really going to talk about boys, are we?

question: So spring training's going well?
answer: Phil's working hard. We're looking around for a house to rent, in case it becomes permanent. You'd like Jacksonville, baby.

question: Actually, Forks is kind of growing on me.
answer: (stops, knows there's

question: Maybe..
answer: Tell me everything! Jock? Indie? Bet he's smart. Is he smart?

question: Well... he is kind of a history buff. I, uh... have to go.
answer: No way, we gotta talk boys. Are you being safe?

question: I'll call you later, Mom. How did you get in here?
answer: The window. As always.

question: You've been here before?
answer: What else is there to do at night?

question: You're a peeping Tom! Perv!
answer: Shh! The Chief will hear you! I just... like watching over you. There's something I'd like to try.

question: Oh... I'm... oh.
answer: I'm stronger than I thought.

question: Wish I could say the same. I'm so embarrassed.
answer: Don't be. But we have to be careful. I can never lose control with you. Ever.

question: I have a date with Edward Cullen.
answer: He's too old for you.

question: We're both juniors. I thought you liked the Cullens.
answer: And I thought you weren't interested in any of the boys in town.

question: Edward doesn't live in town. And it's in the early stage and -
answer: Now? He's out there?

question: He wants to meet you. Officially.
answer: Good.

question: Chief Swan. I wanted to formally introduce myself. I'm Edward. I won't keep Bella out late tonight. We're just going to go play baseball with my family.
answer: Bella's going to play baseball?

question: Yes, sir, that's the plan.
answer: Well. More power to you, I guess.

question: She'll be safe with me, sir, I promise.
answer: You got that pepper spray?

question: I believe this belongs to you.
answer: Thank you.

question: Could you use three more players?
answer: Of course.

question: I'm Laurent. This is Victoria. And James.
answer: Would you like to bat first? I'm afraid your hunting activities have caused something of a mess for us.

question: Our apologies. We didn't realize the territory had been claimed.
answer: Yes, we maintain a permanent residence.

question: The girl is with us.
answer: We won't harm her.

question: I think it best if you leave.
answer: Yes, I can see the game is over. We'll go now. James?

question: Get out! It's over.
answer: Bella? What happened?

question: I have to get out of this place. Out of Forks. I'm leaving. Now. I can't hurt him.
answer: Bells. Did he hurt you?

question: No, Dad.
answer: Then what? Did he break up with you?

question: I broke up with him.
answer: I thought you liked him?

question: Your mother's not even in Phoenix.
answer: She'll come home. I'll call her from the road.

question: You can't drive home now. I'll take you to the airport in the morning.
answer: I want to drive. I need time to think. I'll pull into a motel in a few hours. I promise.

question: No. I don't know. I used to take ballet lessons as a kid. The school had an arch like that.
answer: Was your school here in Phoenix?

question: Yeah, around the corner from my house. But I haven't been there in ten years.
answer: Do you have any reason to go now?

question: No. Hell, no. I hated the place. Edward. Are you alright?
answer: I'm coming to get you. (hates having to say Bella, we're in too deep. We can't change how we feel..

question: No... we can't. When will you get here?
answer: In a couple hours. Then you and

question: Mom, I'm so glad you got my - Calm down, Mom. Everything is fine, okay? I'll explain every ... Mom? Are you there?
answer: I was prepared to wait for you. But then Mom came home after she received a very worried call from your Dad. It all worked out quite well. I must say, Forks High School doesn't protect its students' privacy very well. It was just too easy for Victoria to find your previous address.

question: Leave my mother out of this.
answer: You're protective of her. That's nice. You can still save her. But you'll need to get away from your friends. Can you do that?

question: I... don't think so.
answer: If your mother's life depends on it?

question: Where should I meet you?
answer: The old ballet studio around the corner. And I'll know if you bring anyone along. Poor mommy would pay the price for that mistake.

question: Mom, I suck.
answer: That's my favorite part. Stubborn child, weren't you?

question: She's not here.
answer: Sorry. But you really made it too easy. So to make things more entertaining, I'm going to make a little film of our time together. Borrowed this from your house. Hope you don't mind. Excellent! An escape attempt. It'll break Edward's little heart.

question: Edward has nothing to do with this.
answer: He will. His rage will make for more interesting sport than his feeble attempt to protect you. Beautiful! Very visually dynamic. I chose my stage well. Still stubborn, aren't you? Is that what makes you special? Because frankly, I don't see it. Too bad he didn't have the strength to turn you. Instead, he kept you this fragile little human. It's cruel, really. Well done! You've succeeded in annoying me. Tell Edward how much it hurts. Tell him to avenge you.

question: No! Edward, don't..
answer: Cut! The end. You're alone... because you're faster than the others. But not stronger.

question: What's the other choice? You said
answer: Tighter, above the knee You can try to suck the venom out.

question: I -- won't be able to stop
answer: Find the will to stop. But choose, she only has minutes left.

question: It's alright, Bella. I'll make it go away.
answer: Stop. Her blood is clean, you're killing her.

question: Life... is harder.. Edward? Where's -
answer: He's asleep. She nods across the room to a chair in which Edward sleeps. He never leaves. And your dad's down in the cafeteria.

question: What... happened?
answer: Baby, you fell down two flights of stairs and through a window. Edward came here to convince you to come back to Forks. His father brought him down. You went to their hotel but you tripped on the stairs. A moment... then Bella realizes it's a cover story. She nods.

question: Sounds like me.
answer: It's Phil. He's worried about you.

question: Mom, you're... texting. That's great mom.
answer: Jacksonville is always sunny and you'll have your own bathroom..

question: Mom, wait. I want to live in Forks. I have Dad..
answer: And he's there. Charlie doesn't like him. Blames him for your leaving.

question: What do you think? Um, Mom, would you mind getting Dad?
answer: I'm sure he doesn't care about that, Baby. But Ill go get him.

question: Is James - did you -- ?
answer: We took care of him. And the woman, Victoria, she ran off.

question: I'm alive because of you.
answer: You're in here because of me. The worst of it... was thinking

question: But you did.
answer: Bella, you should go to Jacksonville. Where I can't hurt you anymore..
